Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from three fragments) of Nile Silt pottery amphora; exterior: band at turn of neck; on shoulder, large zig-zag frieze above black band; inscription on exterior. Two modern drill holes for sampling.
Curator's comments: NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn) attributes the piece to the chemical group QanN (sample Nauk 83) and hence to local production in the Nile Delta. Given the Greek style of the piece, it was probably made at Naukratis itself; see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006, 55 table 1, pp. 62-5, fig. 38. The piece is mentioned by Petrie as an example of the pieces of ‘earliest pottery from well [in the Apollo sanctuary] with retrograde inscriptions’ in his fabric group B1 (Petrie 1886a, 17, pl. 33.3).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 3)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 642, no. 5)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.55 Table 1, p. 63 fig. 38)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.02)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 173-4, Nau 143, pl. 31e-f)
